RENIN 1.0
  • Reference

    Function to simulate the results of perturbing a set of TFs in Seurat dataset

    simulate_dataset.Rd

    This function inputs a Seurat object, samples cells from specified cell type, target_celltype, perturbs specified TFs up or down, then simulates the results of those perturbations using the model data frame that contains the estimated regulatory coefficients of each TF for each modeled gene. The function merges the original Seurat object with the perturbed and simulated cells for plotting.

    Usage

    simulate_dataset(
  seurat,
  target_celltype = c(),
  end_celltype = c(),
  model = aen_model,
  genes = rownames(aen_model),
  tfs = colnames(aen_model),
  perturbed_tfs_up = c(),
  perturbed_tfs_down = c(),
  mean_var_df = mean_var,
  how_much = c(1, 5, 10),
  num_starting_cells = 500,
  set.seed = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    seurat

    A Seurat object

    target_celltype

    Starting cell type(s) to sample from, in order to perturb and simulate

    end_celltype

    Ending cell type(s) to sample from, useful to plot with simulated cells to assess trajectory

    model

    Data frame with regulatory coefficients of each TF for each gene

    genes

    Gene names that are present in model

    tfs

    TF names that are present in model

    perturbed_tfs_up

    Names of TFs to upregulate

    perturbed_tfs_down

    Names of TFs to knock down

    mean_var_df

    Data frame with mean expression and standard deviation for modeled genes

    how_much

    Vector of multiples to multiply standard deviation by to determine perturbation amount up or down

    num_starting_cells

    Number of starting cells to sample from target_celltype group to simulate

    set.seed

    Boolean whether to set seed for reproducibility during testing

    Value

    A Seurat object with the perturbed and simulated cells added
